Topic.Title: Rumor: BX Just Deliver Its Offer

Message.Msg: I hate to break bad news to everybody, but nobody is going to pay billions for a company with negative tangible book value. You've got millions of people who think DELL is worth more then $13.65, thousands demanding they pay more, and Icahn threatening legal action and proxy fight. In all this mess, there is one thing you DON'T have. You don't have an offer.

Topic.Title: New Offers will be $15 to $17 range

Message.Msg: When Icahn offered to buy OSK for $32.50 last October, the stock price barely reached $30. He abandoned the bid 6 weeks later. Even if Icahn bids $15 for Dell, I wouldn't expect the current stock price, $14.14, to go up.

Topic.Title: ITS ONLY A DREAM THAT SOME ONE WILL MAKE AN OFFER!

Message.Msg: Even if there are offers, the board doesn't have to accept them, especially if it means they'll be out of a job. Then, Blackstone and Icahn would have to go directly to the shareholders with a tender offer. Not sure it will get done if it doesn't include Michael Dell.

Topic.Title: ITS ONLY A DREAM THAT SOME ONE WILL MAKE AN OFFER!

SouthEastern's average is close to $16.88 They may look to support any offer that is above $17...I think the shorts may have made a mistake with this one....i am increasing getting convinced that this will end up at ATLEAST $17 You have 2 bidders now apart from Silverlake.

Message.Title: Blackstone Group Said to Submit Proposal to Buy Dell
Message.Msg: Blackstone Group Said to Submit Proposal to Buy Dell By David Carey & Cristina Alesci - Mar 23, 2013 10:36 AM CT Blackstone Group LP submitted a tentative offer late yesterday to acquire Dell Inc. (DELL), rivaling a $24.4 billion offer from a group led by Silver Lake Management LLC and company founder Michael Dell, a person familiar with the matter said. The bid will commit Blackstone to hold takeover discussions with the company, said the person, who declined to be identified because the matter is private. Dell has until Tuesday to respond to the offer, the person said. Blackstone spokeswoman Christine Anderson declined to comment.

Topic.Title: Mickey Should Take the $5 Billion Cash and Run

Message.Msg: This is a good business model. Dell has to continue to focus on the cloud and services and move away very slowly on computers. The growth of the industry should continue to improve as the overall global economy improves. The offer is way too low. Those who shorted the stock, you lose.

Message.Title: desktop and laptop are here, will be still here
Message.Msg: Cloud computation, cellular phone, ipad, or whatsoever tablet, etc. can not replace desktop and laptop. As long as people care about privacy, care freedom, care about power computation with surrounding devices, they still need desktop or laptop, in office or at home or on travel. Ask yourself, ask your colleagues, are you still use desktop or laptop? We have all iphone, ipod-touch and ipad, but we have three laptops and one desktop at home. All staffs of our company are using desktops and laptops. So do all over the world. MD knows all these facts. As long as economy improves, the shipping number will increase.

Topic.Title: dell opens @ $15..icahn, blacksione has bidders

Message.Msg: You are probably right. But when people realize that none of the bids top the $24,400,000,000 offer currently on the table, the price will drop. Remember, nobody can beat 24.4 billion. So all these guys are trying to come up with an angle that would allow them to control DELL for less than 24.4B. The board of directors aren't interested in any angle; they are interested in offers above 24.4B. It will take some time for people to realize the difference between an offer and an angle. There will be no offers, but there will be several angles.
